donor_name: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT
outputs.output_descr:
The CPRSPD will be developed as a National Centre for Excellence on poverty related and human development issues. The centre is mandated to conduct evidence based research on poverty related issues for pro-poor policy formulation, analysis, monitoring and evaluation. The overall objectives are to influence public policy for pro poor growth and sustainable human development in consonance with the development strategy envisaged in consonance with the development strategy envisaged in Medium Term Development Frame Work (MTDF) 2005  10 and Vision 2030

The core areas of CPRSPD work are summarized as follow: 

•	Initiate policy debate through scholars and experts
•	Monitoring government poverty reduction programme and activities and train Government departments to improve skills in data collection, analytical techniques for monitoring and evaluation.
•	Monitor progress towards MDG's at national and sub national level and articulate global targets into localized targets through participatory process.
•	Advocate and disseminate MDGR, NHDR and other research to concerned audience
•	Comprehensive poverty impact analysis, in-depth qualitative and quantitative analysis to explore the positive and negative impact of development strategies, programmes and projects on poverty


Structures and processes for MDG-based pro-poor policy planning and research supported.

donor_name: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT
outputs.output_descr:
Structures and processes for MDG-based pro-poor policy planning and research supported.

The purpose of the project is to strengthen institutional capacities for results-based monitoring and evaluation of poverty reduction strategies (PRS). 

The Strengthening PRS Monitoring initiative is comprised of the following outputs:

1.	Public spending and allocations in pro-poor sectors reviewed and analyzed through gender lens to better understand the contribution and needs of men and women.
2.	Quality, collection, analysis and management of PRS data improved at national and province levels.
3.	National engagement in PRS monitoring mobilized through participatory processes. 

The monitoring framework is envisaged to ensure an ongoing and sustainable system, developed to deliver timely and reliable data against a set of well-selected indicators, and feed into the policy process whilst engaging both national and sub-national levels.
